section.title: Strategies and the Current Term
section.para: Strategies are the statements and functions of the Stratego language. A strategy transforms a term into a new term, or fails. The term to which a strategy is applied, is called the current term. In the Stratego Shell you can see the current term with :show.

So, the current term is the empty tuple if you have just started the Stratego Shell. At the prompt of the shell you can enter strategies. If the strategy succeeds, then the shell will show the transformed term, which is now the new current term.
Strategies can also fail. In that case, the shell will print a message and leave the current term untouched:
section.screen: current term stratego> strategy expression command failed stratego> :show current term
